question: In the parable of the sower, what happened to the seed that fell on rocky ground?
choices: It sprouted quickly but withered in the sun
It grew strong and bore fruit
explanation: The seed on rocky ground sprouted quickly but had no root, so it withered when the sun came up.

verses.kjv:
Some fell upon stony places, where they had not much earth: and forthwith they sprung up, because they had no deepness of earth:
And when the sun was up, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.

question: In the parable of the talents, how many talents did the master give to the first servant?
explanation: The master gave five talents to the first servant, two to the second, and one to the third.

verses.kjv: And unto one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one; to every man according to his several ability; and straightway took his journey.

question: In the parable of the ten virgins, what did the foolish virgins forget to bring?
explanation: The foolish virgins took their lamps but didn't bring extra oil, so they weren't prepared when the bridegroom arrived.

verses.kjv:
They that
were foolish took their lamps, and took no oil with them:

question: What did the father give to the prodigal son when he returned home?
explanation: The father gave his returning son the best robe, a ring for his finger, and sandals for his feet.

verses.kjv:
But the father said to his servants, Bring forth the best robe, and put
it on him; and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on
his feet:

question: What did the Pharisee and tax collector do in the temple parable?
explanation: Both went to pray, but the humble tax collector's prayer was heard while the proud Pharisee's was not.

verses.kjv: Two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee, and the other a publican.

question: In the parable of the mustard seed, what does the seed represent?
explanation: Jesus compared the kingdom of heaven to a mustard seed, the smallest seed that grows into a large tree.

verses.kjv:
Another parable put he forth unto them, saying,
The kingdom of heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field:

question: In the parable of the wedding feast, why was one guest cast out?
explanation: The king found a man without wedding clothes and had him thrown into outer darkness.

verses.kjv:
And when the king came in to see the guests, he saw there a man which had not on a wedding garment:
And he saith unto him, Friend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment? And he was speechless.
Then said the king to the servants, Bind him hand and foot, and take him away, and cast
him into outer darkness; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

question: What separated the sheep from the goats in Jesus' teaching?
choices: How they treated others in need
explanation: The sheep helped those in need (hungry, thirsty, stranger, naked, sick, imprisoned), while the goats did not.

verses.kjv:
For I was an hungred, and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me in:
Naked, and ye clothed me: I was sick, and ye visited me: I was in prison, and ye came unto me.
Then shall the righteous answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, and fed
thee? or thirsty, and gave
thee
 drink?
When saw we thee a stranger, and took
thee in? or naked, and clothed
thee?
Or when saw we thee sick, or in prison, and came unto thee?
And the King shall answer and say unto them, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye have done
it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done
it unto me.

question: In the parable of the laborers, when did the last workers arrive?
explanation: The landowner went out at the eleventh hour and found still others standing around doing nothing.

verses.kjv: And about the eleventh hour he went out, and found others standing idle, and saith unto them, Why stand ye here all the day idle?

question: What did the Pharisee thank God for in the temple?
choices: That he was not like other people
explanation: The Pharisee stood by himself and prayed, 'God, I thank you that I am not like other people.'

verses.kjv:
The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself, God, I thank thee, that I am not as other men
are, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this publican.

question: According to Jesus, what defiles a person?
choices: What comes out of their mouth
explanation: What goes into someone's mouth does not defile them, but what comes out of their mouth defiles them.

verses.kjv: Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man; but that which cometh out of the mouth, this defileth a man.

question: In the parable of the Good Samaritan, who passed by the injured man first?
explanation: A priest happened to be going down the same road, and when he saw the man, he passed by on the other side.

verses.kjv: And by chance there came down a certain priest that way: and when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

question: In the parable of the sower, what happened to the seed on rocky ground?
choices: It sprouted but withered in the sun
explanation: But when the sun came up, the plants were scorched, and they withered because they had no root.

verses.kjv: And when the sun was up, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.

question: In the parable of the talents, how many talents did the lazy servant receive?
explanation: To one he gave five talents, to another two talents, and to another one talent.

verses.kjv: And unto one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one; to every man according to his several ability; and straightway took his journey.

question: In the Beatitudes, who will inherit the earth?
explanation: Blessed are the meek, for they will inherit the earth.

verses.kjv:
Blessed
are the meek: for they shall inherit the earth.

question: What did Jesus say about those who are persecuted?
choices: Theirs is the kingdom of heaven
explanation: Blessed are those who are persecuted because of righteousness, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

verses.kjv:
Blessed
are they which are persecuted for righteousness sake: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

question: What did Jesus say we should be as wise as and as innocent as?
explanation: I am sending you out like sheep among wolves. Therefore be as shrewd as snakes and as innocent as doves.

verses.kjv: Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.

question: What did the persistent widow want from the judge?
explanation: And there was a widow in that town who kept coming to him with the plea, 'Grant me justice against my adversary.'

verses.kjv: And there was a widow in that city; and she came unto him, saying, Avenge me of mine adversary.

question: In the parable of the workers, when did the last workers start?
explanation: About five in the afternoon he went out and found still others standing around.

verses.kjv: And about the eleventh hour he went out, and found others standing idle, and saith unto them, Why stand ye here all the day idle?

question: According to Jesus, what should we do when we pray?
choices: Go into your room and close the door
explanation: But when you pray, go into your room, close the door and pray to your Father, who is unseen.

verses.kjv: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.

question: According to Jesus, what will happen if you have faith as small as a mustard seed?
explanation: If you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you can say to this mountain, 'Move from here to there,' and it will move.

verses.kjv:
And Jesus said unto them,
Because of your unbelief: for verily I say unto you, If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove hence to yonder place; and it shall remove; and nothing shall be impossible unto you.

question: What did the father give the prodigal son when he returned?
explanation: But the father said to his servants, 'Quick! Bring the best robe and put it on him. Put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.'

verses.kjv:
But the father said to his servants, Bring forth the best robe, and put
it on him; and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on
his feet:

question: In the parable of the wedding banquet, why did the invited guests not come?
explanation: But they paid no attention and went off—one to his field, another to his business.

verses.kjv:
But they made light of
it, and went their ways, one to his farm, another to his merchandise:

question: Who did the king invite after the original guests refused?
explanation: So go to the street corners and invite to the banquet anyone you find.

verses.kjv: Go ye therefore into the highways, and as many as ye shall find, bid to the marriage.

question: In the parable of the talents, how many talents did the first servant receive?
explanation: To one he gave five bags of gold, to another two bags, and to another one bag, each according to his ability.

verses.kjv: And unto one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one; to every man according to his several ability; and straightway took his journey.

question: What did Jesus say the Kingdom of Heaven is like in terms of a seed?
explanation: The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed, which a man took and planted in his field. Though it is the smallest of all seeds, yet when it grows, it is the largest of garden plants.

verses.kjv:
Another parable put he forth unto them, saying,
The kingdom of heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field:

question: In the parable of the wedding banquet, what happened to the guest without wedding clothes?
explanation: Then the king told the attendants, 'Tie him hand and foot, and throw him outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.'

verses.kjv:
Then said the king to the servants, Bind him hand and foot, and take him away, and cast
him into outer darkness; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

question: What did Jesus say about those who exalt themselves?
explanation: For all those who exalt themselves will be humbled, and those who humble themselves will be exalted.

verses.kjv: For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

question: In the parable of the sower, what did Jesus say the seed is?
explanation: Luke 8:11 says plainly that the seed is the word of God.

verses.kjv: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

question: In the parable of the sower, who comes and takes away the word out of the hearts of those by the way side?
explanation: Luke 8:12 says the devil comes and takes away the word from their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.

verses.kjv: Those by the way side are they that hear; then cometh the devil, and taketh away the word out of their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.

question: According to Luke 8:13, what do people on the rock do when they hear the word?
explanation: Luke 8:13 says those on the rock receive the word with joy but have no root and fall away in time of temptation.

verses.kjv: They on the rock are they, which, when they hear, receive the word with joy; and these have no root, which for a while believe, and in time of temptation fall away.

question: In the parable of the sower, what does the fruitless choking of the seed among thorns represent?
choices: Cares and riches and pleasures of this life
Lack of rain in the field
explanation: Luke 8:14 says the seed among thorns is choked with cares, riches, and pleasures of this life, bringing no fruit to perfection.

verses.kjv: And that which fell among thorns are they, which, when they have heard, go forth, and are choked with cares and riches and pleasures of this life, and bring no fruit to perfection.

question: In the parable of the sower, what kind of heart receives the word and keeps it and brings forth fruit with patience?
explanation: Luke 8:15 says those in good ground are they which in an honest and good heart, having heard the word, keep it and bring forth fruit with patience.

verses.kjv: But that on the good ground are they, which in an honest and good heart, having heard the word, keep it, and bring forth fruit with patience.

question: What did Jesus say is the greatest commandment in the law?
choices: Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind
Thou shalt pay tribute to Caesar
Thou shalt build an altar in Jerusalem
explanation: Matthew 22:37 records Jesus quoting the great commandment: loving God with all the heart, soul, and mind.

verses.kjv: Jesus said unto him, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.

question: According to Jesus, what commandment is like the first and greatest?
choices: Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself
Thou shalt keep the new moons
explanation: Matthew 22:39 says the second commandment is like the first: love thy neighbour as thyself.

verses.kjv: And the second is like unto it, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

question: What did Jesus say hangs on these two commandments?
choices: All the law and the prophets
Only the temple and its service
explanation: Matthew 22:40 says all the law and the prophets hang on the two commandments to love God and love neighbour.

verses.kjv: On these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets.

question: What did Jesus say about the eye if it is single?
choices: Thy whole body shall be full of light
Thy whole body shall be full of darkness
Thy whole body shall be sick
explanation: Matthew 6:22 says if the eye is single, the whole body will be full of light.

verses.kjv: The light of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.

question: What did Jesus say about the eye if it is evil?
choices: Thy whole body shall be full of darkness
Thy whole body shall be full of light
Thy whole body shall become strong
Thy whole body shall be healed
explanation: Matthew 6:23 says if the eye is evil, the whole body shall be full of darkness.

verses.kjv: But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is that darkness!

question: According to Jesus, who cannot serve two masters?
explanation: Matthew 6:24 begins by declaring that no man can serve two masters.

verses.kjv: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

question: What did Jesus say we cannot serve at the same time as God?
explanation: Matthew 6:24 ends with, "Ye cannot serve God and mammon."

verses.kjv: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

question: When Jesus said not to take thought for your life, what did he mention that you should not worry about eating?
choices: How much gold ye shall store
explanation: Matthew 6:25 says take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink, nor for the body what ye shall put on.

verses.kjv: Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the body than raiment?

question: According to Jesus, what should we seek first?
choices: The kingdom of God, and his righteousness
explanation: Matthew 6:33 says to seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things shall be added.

verses.kjv: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.

question: According to Jesus, what will be added unto you if you seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness?
explanation: Matthew 6:33 promises that if you seek first God's kingdom and righteousness, "all these things" will be added.

verses.kjv: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.

question: In the Lord’s Prayer, what did Jesus say to pray regarding daily needs?
choices: Give us this day our daily bread
Give us this year our daily riches
Give us this month our daily tribute
Give us forever our daily food without work
explanation: Matthew 6:11 includes the request, "Give us this day our daily bread."

verses.kjv: Give us this day our daily bread.

question: In the Lord’s Prayer, what did Jesus say to pray about forgiveness?
choices: Forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors
Forgive us after we gain riches
explanation: Matthew 6:12 teaches asking God to forgive our debts as we forgive our debtors.

verses.kjv: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.

question: In the Lord’s Prayer, what did Jesus say to pray concerning temptation?
choices: Lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil
Lead us into temptation to prove us
Keep us from hunger but not evil
explanation: Matthew 6:13 says to pray not to be led into temptation, but to be delivered from evil.

verses.kjv: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen.

question: According to Jesus, what should we do if we forgive men their trespasses?
choices: Your heavenly Father will also forgive you
You will be praised by all men
explanation: Matthew 6:14 says if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.

verses.kjv: For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:

question: According to Jesus, what should we do if we do not forgive men their trespasses?
choices: Neither will your Father forgive your trespasses
explanation: Matthew 6:15 warns that if you do not forgive men, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

verses.kjv: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

question: According to Jesus, where should we lay up treasures instead of on earth?
explanation: Matthew 6:20 says to lay up treasures in heaven where moth and rust do not corrupt and thieves do not break through.

verses.kjv: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:

question: According to Jesus, where will your heart be if your treasure is there?
choices: There will your heart be also
There will your strength be only
explanation: Matthew 6:21 teaches that where your treasure is, your heart will be there as well.

verses.kjv: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
